Key Arguments: Free speech is essential for democracy.
Disinformation is akin to fraud, which is already covered by existing legislation.
Granting power to restrict speech can lead to manipulation of public opinion and historical examples of oppression and misuse of power.
Notable Quotes: Free speech is a necessity to allow a democracy to function.
The power to restrict speech opens the doors for directing public opinion as has happened in other countries in the 20[th] century, leading to oppression, corruption and the misuse of power.
